title: Load different configuration of vehicle
body:
I'm struggling to load a configuration of a vehicle via Python, e.g. using the etk856td_M instead of the default one. Is there any way to do this in Python? The method get_part_config() in the vehicle class gives me the output
```python
{'vars': {}, 'parts': {}, 'pcPath': ''}
```
So I thought I could just use the pcPath argument to pass the path to the .pc file of the configuration like this:
```python
cfg = {'vars': {}, 'parts': {}, 'pcPath': "D:\\Program Files (x86)\\BeamNG\\vehicles\\etk800\\etk856td_M.pc"}
ego.set_part_config(cfg)
```
However, I'm getting a huge error message in the console:

I noticed that in partmgmt.lua the variable is not called "pcPath", but "settings". Changing this didn't solve the issue. Maybe this happens because the other arguments were not passed, but I'm uncertain what these arguments should be. I hope someone can help me out with this problem. Thanks!
